result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey J Marciniak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey J Marciniak in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF86,15CF145,15CM100, 15CT37 & 15FO162.  Called at 3:47 pm    Plea agreement. Amended Information filed for 15CF86.  15CM100 state move to dismiss and read in , 15CT37 and 15CF145 DRI  15CF86 Ct 3 amended.  Plea to Ct 1, 3 & 4.  Probation  & DEJ  15FO162 to be dismissed.  15CF86 Ct 1 DEJ, Ct 2 to be dismiss and read in.  Ct 3 & 4 Probation.   Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed by court.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial reviewed.   Charges and penalties reviewed.  Victim impact statement reviewed by Atty Laufenberg.  Court reviews statement.  Ct 1, 3, 4 no contest pleas.  Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Judgment on Ct 3 &4  Ct 1 Judgment deferred.  Statement by Atty Constable.   Credit of 59 days for 15CF86.  Additional 71 days on other cases.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.   Statement by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  Ct 1 - Deferred 4 yrs, no crimes, no use of alcohol, no possession of firearms, no contact with Victim  AODA.  Sentences withheld, probation  Restitution $120.52.  Ct 3 Fine $100.00 plus cost and DNA Surcharge  Ct 4 $10.00 plus cost & DNA surcharge.  Post conviction rights.  Restitution, fine & cost to be taken from bond.  Return balance of bond to poster.  Probation 2 yrs on each count.    15CM100 bond to be returned to poster.   Court sets signature bond.

Defendant Jeffrey J Marciniak in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg, by telephone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CF86, 15CT37, 15CF145, 15CM100 & 15FO162  @ 10:04 am.  JA on phone for scheduling only.  Parties agree to 15CF86 and 15CM100 to be scheduled for trial, other cases to follow.  Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 31, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on June 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def is in custody and is  coming over from jail.  Cases called15CF145,15CM100,15CF86, 15CT37 and 15FO162.  Def is now present in the court room.  Def is in custody.  15CF145 preliminary hearing request, within time limit.  Court would like to appear by video.  Def objects to court appearing by video.  Counsel confers with def.  Def will not object to court appearing by video.  15CF86 motion to modify bond.  15CT37 bond to be set.  State request that bond of $10,000 cover this.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature for this file.  Balance of cases will follow as status conf.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey J Marciniak
Current: P.O. Box 77, Aniwa, WI 54408 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2015)
Prior: W10554 County Road G, Antigo, WI 54409 
(see 15-CF-86)

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey J Marciniak in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant  in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed with preliminary.  Called at 9:40 am.  Greg Carter, Langlade County Deputy, duly sworn on oath, testitifies.  Exhibit # 1 - Copy of text message on phone.  Exh. # 2 - Copy of text on phone - 3 pgs.  Exh # 3 - Copy of text messages on phone  State offers exhibits 1,2,&3.  State has no further witnesses.  Nothing by defense.  Closing statement by Atty Abernethy-Mays, motion to dismiss.  Response by state.  Court finds probable cause, bound over.  Information filed.  Information received.  Not guilty plea entered.  Time extended for counsel to substitute judge.   Review of bond.  Arguments by Atty Abernethy-Mays for bond to be reduced.  Response by State.  Court will deny motion to reduce bond.  New charges have been filed  Counsel has copies of complaints.  Status conf set, pendintg new Judge being assigned.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
